name: codefresh
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing codefresh cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`codefresh` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/codefresh-io/terraform-provider-codefresh).

nodejs.packageDescription: A Pulumi package for creating and managing codefresh cloud resources.
nodejs.readme:
> This provider is a derived work of the [Terraform Provider](https://github.com/codefresh-io/terraform-provider-codefresh)
> distributed under [MPL 2.0](https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/MPL/2.0/). If you encounter a bug or missing feature,
> first check the [`pulumi-codefresh` repo](https://github.com/pierskarsenbarg/pulumi-codefresh/issues); however, if that doesn't turn up anything,
> please consult the source [`terraform-provider-codefresh` repo](https://github.com/codefresh-io/terraform-provider-codefresh/issues).

parallel.description:
How many pipelines can be run in parallel.
` `node` - (Optional) Number of nodes.

dataRetentionWeeks.description: -(Optional) How long in weeks will the builds be stored.

config.description: A `config` block as documented below. Shared Config [spec](https://codefresh-io.github.io/cli/contexts/spec/config/).

secret.description: A `secret` block as documented below. Shared Secret [spec](https://codefresh-io.github.io/cli/contexts/spec/secret/).

secretyaml.description: A `secretyaml` block as documented below. Secret Yaml Configuration Context[spec](https://codefresh-io.github.io/cli/contexts/spec/secret-yaml/).

yaml.description: A `yaml` block as documented below. Yaml Configuration Context [spec](https://codefresh-io.github.io/cli/contexts/spec/yaml/).

data.description: Map of strings representing the variables to be defined in the Shared Config.

branchConcurrency.description: The maximum amount of concurrent builds that may run for each branch

concurrency.description: The maximum amount of concurrent builds.

contexts.description: A list of strings representing the contexts ([shared_configuration](https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/configure-ci-cd-pipeline/shared-configuration/)) to be configured for the pipeline

priority.description: Helps to organize the order of builds execution in case of reaching the concurrency limit.

requiredAvailableStorage.description: Minimum disk space required for build filesystem ( unit Gi is required)

runtimeEnvironments.description: A collection of `runtime_environment` blocks as documented below.

specTemplates.description: A collection of `spec_template` blocks as documented below.

triggerConcurrency.description: The maximum amount of concurrent builds that may run for each trigger.

triggers.description: A collection of `trigger` blocks as documented below. Triggers [documentation](https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/configure-ci-cd-pipeline/triggers/git-triggers/).

keepPvcsForPendingApproval.description:
Boolean for the Settings under pending approval: `When build enters "Pending Approval" state, volume should`:
* Default (attribute not specified): "Use Setting accounts"
* true: "Remain (build remains active)"
* false: "Be removed"

pendingApprovalConcurrencyApplied.description:
Boolean for the Settings under pending approval: `Pipeline concurrency policy: Builds on "Pending Approval" state should be`:
* Default (attribute not specified): "Use Setting accounts"
* true: "Included in concurrency"
* false: "Not included in concurrency"

name.description: A name of runtime.

path.description: The relative path to the Codefresh pipeline file.

revision.description: The pipeline's revision. Should be added to the **lifecycle/ignore_changes** or incremented mannually each update.

onTerminateAnnotation.description: Boolean. Enables the policy `Once a build is terminated, terminate all child builds initiated from it`. Default false.

branchName.description: A regular expression to filter the branches on with the termination policy applies.

ignoreBranch.description: Boolean. See table below for usage.

ignoreTrigger.description: Boolean. See table below for usage.

branchRegex.description: A regular expression and will only trigger for branches that match this naming pattern.

branchRegexInput.description: Flag to manage how the `branch_regex` field is interpreted. Possible values: "multiselect-exclude", "multiselect", "regex". Default: "regex"

commentRegex.description: A regular expression and will only trigger for pull requests where a comment matches this naming pattern.

commitStatusTitle.description: The commit status title pushed to the GIT version control system.

contexts.description: A list of strings representing the contexts ([shared_configuration](https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/configure-ci-cd-pipeline/shared-configuration/)) to be loaded when the trigger is executed

disabled.description: Boolean. If true, trigger will never be activated.

events.description: A list of GitHub events for which a Pipeline is triggered. Default value - **push.heads**.

modifiedFilesGlob.description: Allows to constrain the build and trigger it only if the modified files from the commit match this glob expression.

name.description: The display name for the pipeline.

pullRequestAllowForkEvents.description: Boolean. If this trigger is also applicable to Git forks.

pullRequestTargetBranchRegex.description: A regular expression and will only trigger for pull requests to branches that match this naming pattern.

runtimeEnvironments.description:
A collection of `runtime_environment` blocks as documented below.
- `options`: (Optional) A collection `option` blocks as documented below.
---

enableNotifications.description: Boolean. If false the pipeline will not send notifications to Slack and status updates back to the Git provider. Default false

noCache.description: Boolean. If true, docker layer cache is disabled. Default false

noCfCache.description: Boolean. If true, extra Codefresh caching is disabled. Default false

resetVolume.description: Boolean. If true, all files on volume will be deleted before each execution. Default false

name.description: A name of runtime.

domain.description: _(Required)_ String representing your acr registry domain.

region.description: _(Required)_ String representing one of the Amazon regions

keyfile.description: _(Required)_ String representing service account json file contents

location.description: _(Required)_ String representing one of the Google's gar locations

domain.description: _(Required)_ String representing one of the Google's gcr domains

keyfile.description: _(Required)_ String representing service account json file contents

versionNumber.description: String representing the semVer for the step

provider.description:
The provider type for the codefresh package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

action.description:
Action to be allowed. Possible values:
- __create__
- __read__
- __update__
- __delete__
- __run__ (Only valid for `pipeline` resource)
- __approve__ (Only valid for `pipeline` resource)
- __debug__ (Only valid for `pipeline` resource)

resource.description:
The type of resource the permission applies to. Possible values:
- __pipeline__
- __cluster__

tags.description:
The effective tags to apply the permission. It supports 2 custom tags:
- __untagged__ is a tag which refers to all clusters that dont have any tag.
- __*__ (the star character) means all tags.

team.description: The Id of the team the permissions apply to.

originalYamlString.description:
A string with original yaml pipeline.
- `original_yaml_string = "version: "1.0"
steps:
  test:
    image: alpine:latest
    commands:
      - echo "ACC tests""`
- or `original_yaml_string = file("/path/to/my/codefresh.yml")`

codefresh:index/pipelineCronTrigger:Pipe.description:
## # Pipeline Cron Trigger resource

Pipeline Cron Trigger is used to create cron-based triggers for pipeilnes.
See the [documentation](https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/configure-ci-cd-pipeline/triggers/cron-triggers/).

expression.description: The cron expression. Visit [this page](https://github.com/codefresh-io/cronus/blob/master/docs/expression.md) to learn about the supported cron expression format and aliases.

message.description: The message which will be passed to the pipeline upon each trigger.

pipelineId.description: The pipeline to which this trigger belongs.

expression.description: The cron expression. Visit [this page](https://github.com/codefresh-io/cronus/blob/master/docs/expression.md) to learn about the supported cron expression format and aliases.

message.description: The message which will be passed to the pipeline upon each trigger.

pipelineId.description: The pipeline to which this trigger belongs.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering PipelineCronTrigger resources.

pipelineId.description: The pipeline to which this trigger belongs.

codefresh:index/stepTypes:StepTypes.description:
## # Step-types Resource

The Step-types resource allows to create your own typed step and manage all it's published versions.
The resource allows to handle the life-cycle of the version by allowing specifying multiple blocks `version` where the user provides a version number and the yaml file representing the plugin.
More about custom steps in the [official documentation](https://codefresh.io/docs/docs/codefresh-yaml/steps/#creating-a-typed-codefresh-plugin).

## Known limitations and disclaimers

### Version and name in yaml Metadata are ignored.
The version and name of the step declared in the yaml files are superseeded by the attributes specified at resource level:
- `name` : at top level
- `version_numer`: specified in the `version` block
The above are added/replaced at runtime time.

### Number of API requests
This resource makes a lot of additional API calls to validate the steps and retrieve all the version available.
Caution is recommended on the amount of versions maintained and the number of resources defined in a single project.

codefresh:index/getContext:getContext.description:
## # Data Source: codefresh.Context

This data source allows to retrieve information on any defined context

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getContext.

name.description: Name of the context to be retrived

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getContext.

data.description: The yaml string representing the context. Use the `yamldecode` function to access the values belonging the context.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

type.description: String identifying the type of extracted context. E.g. `config`, `secret`, `git.github-app`, etc.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getCurrentAccount.

* `repository prefix` - String representing the optional prefix for registry.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

registryProvider.description: String identifying the type of registry. E.g. `dockerhub, ecr, acr` and others
